pillars.name: core strategies
description: Current services offered to customers that provide a revenue stream
Includes, but is not limited to, energy production, energy sales, and additional services such as telecommunications or consulting.
levels: Energy generation from one source (i.e. nuclear)
Mixture of non-renewable and renewable energy production
Primarily renewable energy production from multiple sources

pillars.name: innovation & flexibility
description: Investments in new technologies or secondary markets that are not implemented in the current business model nor providing a revenue stream.
Willingness and ability to transition to new core strategies
levels: No resources allocated to developing new technologies
Against new technology trends in the market
Limited resources dedicated to new technologies
Lack of strategic plans for implementing new technologies
Resources dedicated to new technologies and secondary markets
Strategic plans for implementation of niche technologies

pillars.name: customer interface
description: Community involvement, customer service, educational programs
Education programs can be related to knowledge and awareness of sustainability, green energy, reducing consumption, and price indexes
levels: Limited to no customer-oriented services (i.e. consulting)
Actively attempting to understand consumer needs

pillars.name: revenue model
description: Net profits gained from offered services
Strategies to implement new technologies to profit
levels: Stagnant/no noticeable trend in profit year-to-year
Limited ability to turn new technologies to profitable services
Ability to implement new technologies to gain profit
